panels.description: The rate of errors encountered by this component.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_errors_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component errors rate

panels.description: The rate of events dropped by this component.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_discarded_events_total{ component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component discarded events rate

targets.expr: sum(rate({application="dead-letter-queue", host="$host"} | json [$__interval]))
{application="dead-letter-queue", host="$host"} | json
sum(rate({application="vector", host="$host", pid="$pid"} | json | metadata_level = `ERROR` [$__interval]))
{application="vector", host="$host", pid="$pid"} | json | metadata_level = `ERROR`

panels.description: The total number of seconds the Vector instance has been up.

targets.expr: vector_uptime_seconds{host =~ "$host", job =~ "$job"}

panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: A ratio from 0 to 1 of the load on a component. A value of 0 would indicate a completely idle component that is simply waiting for input. A value of 1 would indicate a that is never idle. This value is updated every 5 seconds.

targets.expr: vector_utilization { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }

panels.title: Utilization

panels.description: The total number of metrics emitted from the internal metrics registry.

targets.expr: vector_internal_metrics_cardinality

panels.title: Internal metrics cardinality

panels.description: The rate of events emitted by this component.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_sent_events_total{ component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component sent events rate

panels.description: The rate of event bytes emitted by this component.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_sent_event_bytes_total{ component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component sent event bytes rate

panels.description: The rate of raw bytes sent by this component to destination sinks.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_sent_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component sent bytes rate

panels.description:
A histogram of the number of events passed in each internal batch in Vector’s internal topology.

Note that this is separate than sink-level batching. It is mostly useful for low level debugging performance issues in Vector due to small internal batches.

targets.expr: vector_component_received_events_count_count{ component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }

panels.title: Component received events count

panels.description: The rate of event bytes accepted by this component either from tagged origins like file and uri, or cumulatively from other origins.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_received_event_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component received event bytes rate

panels.description: The rate of raw bytes accepted by this component from source origins.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_received_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component received bytes rate

panels.description: The rate of events accepted by this component either from tagged origins like file and uri, or cumulatively from other origins.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_received_events_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component received events rate

panels.description: The rate of events sent by this buffer.

targets.expr: rate(vector_buffer_sent_events_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Sent events rate

panels.description: The number of bytes current in the buffer.

panels.title: Byte size

panels.description: The rate of events received by this buffer.

targets.expr: rate(vector_buffer_received_events_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Received events rate

panels.description: The number of events currently in the buffer.

targets.expr: vector_buffer_events { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }

panels.title: Events

targets.expr: rate(vector_files_added_total { host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Added rate

targets.expr: rate(vector_files_resumed_total { host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job" }[$__rate_interval])
